node.title: How to write my own kernel about surface tension term
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I am a new MOOSE user and trying to compile my own kernel, I have already gone through the examples on the MOOSE tutorial homepage but am still confused about the source code.
The exact problem I want to solve is similar to @liang-tech so I am trying to understand the code here:
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/discussions/23382
The key point in his reference paper doi:10.1103/PhysRevE.106.015111 is the surface tension part in Navier-stokes equation combined with Cahn Hilliard equation, fr = psi * grad phi (psi is the chemical potential and phi denotes the phase)
Some questions from my side are listed:


when should we calculate qp Jacobian? Why in the following example there are only "compute QP residual"?
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/examples_and_tutorials/tutorial01_app_development/step03_moose_object.html


what is off-diagonal Jacobian and when do we need to calculate it? Based on the link above, there is no off-diagonal Jacobian. Is there any introduction about what these variables (such as jvar, jac) mean?


how do we decide which kind of other base objects to heritage? Because in the tutorial, it shows " ADDiffusion : public ADKernelGrad" and I can only find these examples.



thanks for your help!

when should we calculate qp Jacobian? Why in the following example there are only "compute QP residual"?
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/examples_and_tutorials/tutorial01_app_development/step03_moose_object.html


In that example, the Jacobian is computed automatically using automatic differentiation (AD). If you use AD then you do not need to hand-code a Jacobian.


what is off-diagonal Jacobian and when do we need to calculate it? Based on the link above, there is no off-diagonal Jacobian. Is there any introduction about what these variables (such as jvar, jac) mean?


With AD no Jacobian routines are necessary. I would recommend starting with AD and then once you are modeling your physics successfully you can worry about optimizing code speed and hand-coding your Jacobians.


how do we decide which kind of other base objects to heritage? Because in the tutorial, it shows " ADDiffusion : public ADKernelGrad" and I can only find these examples.


If the weak form of your term only involves the test function and not its gradient, then you can use ADKernelValue. If you only use the test function gradient and not its value, then you use ADKernelGrad.  If it uses both gradient and value, then you use ADKernel.

node.title: Need parent dir for computeJacobian under phase_field
node.bodyText:
hi,
I am currently working on implementing the Multi-scale Finite Volume (MsFV) method into the MOOSE framework. As part of this implementation, I require the parent directory for the computeJacobian method, which is responsible for generating a Jacobian matrix within the phase_field module. However, I have been unable to locate the specific directory, and I would greatly appreciate your assistance in this matter.
Thank you very much for your help.

Hello
Every kernel and BC should have its own computeJacobian routine
The ones that do not usually leverage automatic differentiation, which is able to compute derivatives in computeResidual calls
Guillaume

node.title: convergence problems
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I'm asking you for help because I did a 3D model with faults and a HydroThermoMechanical coupling with PorousFlowFullySaturated in my input file but I do not manage to make it converge. I don't know if it is a problem of scaling, or the mesh, or the parameters so if you have any idea tell me :D Here is the link to the mesh file https://we.tl/t-DSWRd63Jks
`[Mesh]
[basic_mesh]
type = FileMeshGenerator
file=Mol_Mesh3.e
[ ]
[renamed_mesh]
type = RenameBlockGenerator
input = basic_mesh
old_block = '0 1 2 3'
new_block = 'matrix Ber Des Ret'
[]
[finalMesh]
type = RenameBoundaryGenerator
input = renamed_mesh
old_boundary = '1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9'
new_boundary = 'bottom top Ber Des Ret front left back right'
[]
[ ]
[GlobalParams]#Every parameter in the block will be inserted into every block/sub-block where that parameter name is defined
PorousFlowDictator = dictator
displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
biot_coefficient=0.85
[ ]
[Variables]#define the unknowns within a system of partial differential equations
[porepressure]
initial_condition=38.3E6
[ ]
[temperature]
initial_condition=401.15
scaling=1E-6
[]
[disp_x]
scaling=1E-10
[ ]
[disp_y]
scaling=1E-10
[ ]
[disp_z]
scaling=1E-10
[ ]
[ ]
[BCs]
[porepressure]
type = DirichletBC #Imposes the essential boundary condition u=g
value = 38.3E6 #pression initiale du fluide en Pascal
variable = porepressure
boundary = 'right left top bottom back front'
[ ]
[temperature]
type = DirichletBC
variable = temperature
value = 401.15
boundary = 'right left top bottom back front'
[]
[stress_x_right]
type = NeumannBC #Imposes the integrated boundary condition du/dn=h
value = -55.75E6 #pourquoi ??
variable = disp_x
boundary = right
[ ]
[stress_x_left]
type = NeumannBC
value = 55.75E6
variable = disp_x
boundary = left
[ ]
[stress_y_back]
type = NeumannBC
value = -55.75E6
variable = disp_y
boundary = back
[ ]
[stress_y_front]
type = NeumannBC
value = 55.75E6
variable = disp_y
boundary = front
[ ]
[stress_z_top]
type = NeumannBC
value = -55.75E6
variable = disp_z
boundary = top
[ ]
[stress_z_bottom]
type = NeumannBC
value = 55.75E6
variable = disp_z
boundary = bottom
[ ]
[ ]
[PorousFlowFullySaturated]
porepressure = porepressure
temperature = temperature
coupling_type = ThermoHydroMechanical
gravity = '0 0 0'
fp = the_simple_fluid
stabilization=KT
eigenstrain_names = 'thermal_contribution ini_stress'
add_stress_aux=true
use_displaced_mesh = false
[]
[DiracKernels]
[fluid_injection]
type = PorousFlowPointSourceFromPostprocessor
point = '202340 213597 -3126.2'
mass_flux = 18.05
variable = porepressure
[]
[source_h]
type = PorousFlowPointEnthalpySourceFromPostprocessor
variable = temperature
mass_flux = 18.05
point = '202340 213597 -3126.2'
T_in = 333.15
pressure = porepressure
fp = the_simple_fluid
[]
[fluid_production]
type = PorousFlowPointSourceFromPostprocessor
point = '202340 212731 -3168.34'
mass_flux = -18.05
variable = porepressure
[]
[]
[FluidProperties]
[the_simple_fluid]#Fluid properties for a simple fluid with a constant bulk density
type = SimpleFluidProperties
bulk_modulus = 2E9
viscosity = 1.0E-3
density0 = 1000.0
thermal_expansion = 0.0002
cp = 4194
cv = 4186
porepressure_coefficient = 0
[ ]
[ ]
[Materials]
[porosity_reservoir]
type = PorousFlowPorosity
porosity_zero = 0.024
mechanical = false
fluid = true
reference_porepressure = 38.3E6
solid_bulk = 15E9
block='matrix'
[ ]
[porosity_faults]
type = PorousFlowPorosityConst
porosity=1
block='Ber Des Ret'
[ ]
[permeability_reservoir]
type = PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman #calculates the permeability tensor
poroperm_function = kozeny_carman_phi0
k0 = 1.5E-12
m = 2 #(1-porosity) exponent
n = 3 #Porosity exponent
phi0 = 0.024
block='matrix'
[ ]
[permeability_faults]
type = PorousFlowPermeabilityConst
permeability='1E-14 0 0 0 1E-14 0 0 0 1E-14'
block='Ber Des Ret'
[ ]
[rock_internal_energy_rock]
type = PorousFlowMatrixInternalEnergy
density = 2700.0
specific_heat_capacity = 1200.0
block='matrix'
[]
[rock_internal_energy_fault]
type = PorousFlowMatrixInternalEnergy
density = 2700.0
specific_heat_capacity = 0
block='Ber Des Ret'
[]
[thermal_conductivity]
type = PorousFlowThermalConductivityIdeal
dry_thermal_conductivity = '2.6 0 0  0 2.6 0  0 0 2.6'
[]
[elasticity_tensor]
type = ComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
bulk_modulus = 15E9
poissons_ratio = 0.281
[]
[strain]
type = ComputeSmallStrain
displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
eigenstrain_names ='thermal_contribution ini_stress'
[ ]
[thermal_contribution]
type = ComputeThermalExpansionEigenstrain
temperature = temperature
thermal_expansion_coeff = 10E-5 # this is the linear thermal expansion coefficient
eigenstrain_name = thermal_contribution
stress_free_temperature = 401.15
[]
[stress]
type = ComputeLinearElasticStress
[ ]
[ini_stress]
type = ComputeEigenstrainFromInitialStress
initial_stress = ' -55.75E6 0 0 0 -55.75E6 0 0 0 -77.7E6'
eigenstrain_name = ini_stress
[ ]
[ ]
[Postprocessors]#object that computes a single scalar
[runtime]
type = PerfGraphData
data_type = TOTAL
section_name = 'Root'
[ ]
    [porepressure]
        type = PointValue
        point = '203457 214307 -3531.87'
        variable = porepressure
    [ ]
    [temperature]
        type = PointValue
        point = '203457 214307 -3531.87'
        variable = temperature
    [ ]

[ ]
[Preconditioning]#to define which type of preconditioning matrix to build and what process to apply
active = basic
[basic]
type = SMP#Single matrix preconditioner (SMP) builds a preconditioner using user defined off-diagonal parts of the Jacobian
full = true
[ ]
[ ]
[Executioner]
type = Transient #Executioner for time varying simulations
solve_type = Newton
nl_abs_tol = 1E-3
end_time = 50
[TimeStepper]
type = TimeSequenceStepper
time_sequence = '0 10 20 30 40 50'
[ ]
steady_state_detection = true
[ ]
[Outputs]
perf_graph = true
exodus = true
csv = true
[ ]`

Hello
your nonlinear tolerance is likely too loose for starters. You could turn on automatic_scaling in the executioner to get a more fair convergence criterion.
Then two things: you ll only want to use Newton s method if your Jacobian has been coded 100% correctly. You can check that using the analyze_jacobian utility or by checking if a finite different preconditioner makes a difference.
Then you ll want to work on preconditioning. You are getting the default right now. If you can afford it you could try a direct solve with LU preconditioning.
All this advice and much more is summarized on the « troubleshooting failed solve » page on the website
Guillaume

The Jacobian should be ok, but I agree the tolerance should be tighter.
As a guess, I would be almost certain that your BC's on displacements are the issue. Could you replace them with roller BC's to test - so DirichletBC's with value = 0 for each displacement?
This converges better with Dirichlet indeed :D Is there a better way to impose the initial stress state of the rock ?

node.title: Thermal conductivity file
node.bodyText:
Hello Everyone,
I am trying lately to define one of my variables in the heat conduction equation which is the thermal conductivity as it looks in the graph below:

I have already defined this variable using a csv file (packed column) and it works, the problem for me is that I want to have a csv file which include data as in the graph, to my knowledge this is impossible as I am defining two outputs for the same input (two thermal conductivity values for one temperature), I thought  about using timeperiods to control this but I think it is not accurate as different regions will have different temperatures and the thermal conductivity values will not be the correct ones for the different regions.
Any suggestions regarding this to be able to define thermal conductivity as in the graph?
Thanks

Hello
Do you have a variable for the phase fraction?
I think you could blend two thermal conductivities (from two CSV files for example). You just need some variable to decide the mix of each
Guillaume

node.title: How to Apply Shear Force at Boundary
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I have an elastoplastic model with a shear force boundary condition. But I am not sure which boundary types I should use for the tensor mechanics problem. I have tried Pressure and it doesn't work in my model. Could you give me some suggestions about which boundary types I could use to apply shear force at the boundary?
Best,
zc

I think this has come up before
Is it similar to this?
#24726

For Pressure under the tensor_mechanics module, I copied this file to the bcs and modified the name of it. The only modification for the header file and the c file is that I changed the Pressure to MyShear, and I got this error after compiling
explicit instantiation of non-template type.
Do you know how to solve this class template problem?
Can you paste the source and header? I can guess right now but it d be easier to say which line
What is MyShearParent? Is that defined?
Also the header is still all about Pressure, not your custom MyShear class?
Actually, I am not sure how to define the MyShearParent and the class. Could you give me some info about it?

It seems you copy pasted the header but did not change it to refer to myShearParent instead of PressureParent.
Unless you did not mean to create a myShearParent class?

I think these are wrong:
class Pressure : public MyShearTempl<false>

typedef MyShearTempl<true> ADPressure;

unless you want to be overriding the current Pressure class

node.title: Issues after update
node.bodyText:
After I update MOOSE and compile my previous project with make -j4, the following error comes up
/Users/sunqingpei/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/Moose.h:55:1: error: static_assert failed due to requirement '201402L >= 201703L' "MOOSE requires a C++17 compatible compiler (GCC >= 7.5.0, Clang >= 5.0.2). Please update your compiler or, if compatible, add '-std=c++17' to your compiler flags and try again. If using the MOOSE conda package, please attempt a MOOSE environment update (using mamba update --all). If this update is not successful, please create a new MOOSE environment (see https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/conda.html#uninstall-conda-moose-environment)."
My Clang version is 12.0.0 (clang-1200.0.32.29), does it meet the version requirement or it's due to the compiler flag problem?
Thanks very much.
And how to modify the compiler flags?

Can you post your libmesh_diagnostic.log? It should be located at moose/scripts/libmesh_diagnostic.log. Unless you are not building your own libMesh and using Conda packages? I can't tell with the output provided.

Thanks for your reply. According to the answer in #24957, I first check the environment variables, and the results are
CXXFLAGS=-march=core2 -mtune=haswell -mssse3 -ftree-vectorize -fPIC -fPIE -fstack-protector-strong -O2 -pipe -stdlib=libc++ -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -std=c++14 -fmessage-length=0 -isystem /Users/sunqingpei/miniconda3/envs/moose/include
DEBUG_CXXFLAGS=-march=core2 -mtune=haswell -mssse3 -ftree-vectorize -fPIC -fPIE -fstack-protector-strong -O2 -pipe -stdlib=libc++ -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -std=c++14 -fmessage-length=0 -Og -g -Wall -Wextra -isystem /Users/sunqingpei/miniconda3/envs/moose/include
Then I use  export CXXFLAGS="—std=c++17:$CXXFLAGS" to add the flag, but the compiling still has error as below
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /Users/sunqingpei/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/kernels_Unity.C...
clang-11: error: no such file or directory: '—std=c++17:-march=core2'
clang-11: error: no such file or directory: '—std=c++17:-march=core2'
just make sure the syntax is correct. It s not accepting —std=c++17:-march=core2, try with a space
Could you please explain a little bit about putting a space in which place? IS it in the command export CXXFLAGS="—std=c++17:$CXXFLAGS"      Thanks very much.

try
export CXXFLAGS="—std=c++17 $CXXFLAGS"

but starting from the previous definition of CXXFLAGS (so open a new tab first)

Thanks. I try the following commands in a new terminal window
(base) sunqingpei@sundeMacBook-Pro ~ % conda activate moose
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 ~ % export CXXFLAGS="—std=c++17 $CXXFLAGS"
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 ~ % cd ~/projects/lemur_PFv3
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 lemur_PFv3 % make -j4
Bu the following error still exists
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /Users/sunqingpei/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/kernels_Unity.C...
clang-11: error: no such file or directory: '—std=c++17'
clang-11: error: no such file or directory: '—std=c++17'
try exporting the list of flags directly then, without referring to the old value of CXXFLAGS
also it should be -std=c++17 not --std=c++17
can you paste the output of echo $CXXFLAGS ? it should already be there

Yes, it seems -std=c++17 was written as --std=c++17 previously. But this time after I input the following
(base) sunqingpei@sundeMacBook-Pro ~ % conda activate moose
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 ~ % export CXXFLAGS="-std=c++17 $CXXFLAGS"
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 ~ % cd ~/projects/lemur_PFv3
(moose) sunqingpei@x86_64-apple-darwin13 lemur_PFv3 % make -j4
Same error as at the very beginning comes up
/Users/sunqingpei/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/Moose.h:55:1: error: static_assert failed due to requirement '201402L >= 201703L' "MOOSE requires a C++17 compatible compiler (GCC >= 7.5.0, Clang >= 5.0.2). Please update your compiler or, if compatible, add '-std=c++17' to your compiler flags and try again. If using the MOOSE conda package, please attempt a MOOSE environment update (using mamba update --all). If this update is not successful, please create a new MOOSE environment (see https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/conda.html#uninstall-conda-moose-environment)."

node.title: Could you see my kernel if it is wrong?
node.bodyText:
Hello Moose experts,
I am making a kernel for Qpresidual and QpJacobian so I want to ask Moose experts if my kernel is right.
This is the residual that I want to implement.

Below is a part of my . C file.
Real
NernstElec::computeQpResidual()
{
  return _elec_cond[_qp] * _u[_qp] * _grad_u[_qp] * _grad_test[_i][_qp];
}

Real
NernstElec::computeQpJacobian()
{
  return _elec_cond[_qp] * _grad_test[_i][_qp] * (_phi[_j][_qp] * _grad_u[_qp] + _u[_qp] * _grad_phi[_j][_qp]);
}

_elec_cond[_qp] is a material property that is considered a constant.
I am not sure, especially, the Jacobian part.
Could you see my kernel if it is wrong?
If it is, can you teach me the right one?
Also, It would be a big help if you tell me the reference from which I can learn how to implement simple Jacobian and also OffDiagJacobian.
Thank you.
Best Wishes,
Jeonghwan

Hello
It looks right to me.
But fortunately you dont have to trust me either, you can use our automated jacobian testing to check:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/help/development/analyze_jacobian.html
There's no off-diagonal terms here, as there is no other variable than the variable for this equation in this term.
Guillaume
Thank you so much!!

node.title: adding gravity with PorousFlowFullySaturated
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
I used PorousFlowFullySaturated in my input file and I tried to add gravity but here is the error i get :

What I'm missing ?
Thanks in advance for your help !

Hello
it looks like you should be defining a density material property in all the regions that have gravity.
you should look at examples in the porous flow module to see how they do that
Guillaume
Yeah, you probably should add a PorousFlowTotalGravitationalDensityFullySaturatedFromPorosity material

node.title: MOOSE compilation and unable to use debugger build executable due Lib mesh error
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am trying to build an executable to debug my application. By using METHOD=dbg make -j1, I got the following error:
Linking Library /home/salau/projects/moose/modules/peridynamics/lib/libperidynamics-dbg.la...
libtool:   error: '/home/salau/projects/moose/modules/peridynamics/build/unity_src/nodalkernels_Unity.x86_64-conda-linux-gnu.dbg.lo' is not a valid libtool object
make: *** [/home/salau/projects/moose/framework/app.mk:345: /home/salau/projects/moose/modules/peridynamics/lib/libperidynamics-dbg.la] Error 1

How do I go about this?

Hello
Git clean the repo then try to build again
Guillaume

Thank you, I have been trying this and the build is still not succesful.
In fact, I even try to install a new MOOSE which also fails to build. The error I got is this:
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/base/ResidualObject.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/base/MaxVarNDofsPerNode.C...

Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/utils/MooseEnum.C...
/home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/base/MooseApp.C: In constructor 'MooseApp::MooseApp(InputParameters)':
/home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/base/MooseApp.C:411:48: error: 'class libMesh::Parallel::Communicator' has no member named 'sync_type'
  411 |   const_cast<Parallel::Communicator &>(comm()).sync_type(timpi_sync);   
      |                                                ^~~~~~~~~
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/utils/SolutionInvalidityRegistry.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/utils/LeastSquaresFitBase.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/utils/MooseEnumBase.C...
make: *** [/home/salau/projects/moose/framework/build.mk:148: /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/src/base/MooseApp.x86_64-conda-linux-gnu.opt.lo] Error 1     
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

let s update libmesh and moose again.
This looks like MOOSE is more up to date than libmesh
see this page
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/new_users.html#update
Okay. I will wait for both the libmesh and moose to be updated.

you need to update locally.
We are in sync at all times with the repo. So a brand new install should always work.
The problem arose because you updated libmesh (through conda) or MOOSE (through git)

I have done that a couple of times today and am still getting a failed build.
I have a brand new install:
cd ~/projects
rm -rf moose
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git
cd moose
git checkout master


The installation works fine and I build using:
cd ~/projects/moose/test
make -j 4


This still give the following error:
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/parser_Unity.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/relationshipmanagers_Unity.C...
x86_64-conda-linux-gnu-c++: fatal error: Killed signal terminated program cc1plus
compilation terminated.
make: *** [/home/salau/projects/moose/framework/build.mk:148: /home/salau/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/systems_Unity.x86_64-conda-linux-gnu.opt.lo] Error 1

this is yet another error message though
x86_64-conda-linux-gnu-c++: fatal error: Killed signal terminated program cc1plus
usually means you are running out of memory. Try make -j 2 and if not, make -j 1

Hello,
I am trying to use the traditional method of debugging the libmesh by setting up several print statements in the code using standard ostream. For now, I am modifying the fe_map.C.  I followed up with the procedures of updating the libmesh by running the script update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh  as found here:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/build_libmesh.html

are you on mac or linux?
and when building libmesh, did you skip-submodule-update ?

Yes,
I did try (base) salau@LAPTOP-9A1UOG6G:~/projects/moose/scripts$ ./update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh --skip-submodule-update.
I am on Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

If you ldd moose_test-opt or whatever executable you are building, do you see the expected libmesh in moose/libmesh
Are you sure that the code you are writing in libmesh is being executed?

node.title: How to output results on integration points
node.bodyText:
Hello All
Now I output variables in postprocessors in the type of ElementAverageValue. How to output the results on integration points? What type I should choose?

Thanks
Pengfei

Hello
I don’t think we have a quadrature point sampler for variables. However if you use a ParsedMaterial to mirror the variable value (I think stresses are already material properties so you might not even need that) then you can use a
MaterialVectorPostprocessor (in the VectorPostprocessors block) to sample the variable value indirectly
Guillaume
